abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column submits overturned conviction of three Brooklyn men on charges of setting 1980 fire in Park Slope, Brooklyn, marks turning point in long evolution of forensic science from procedure rooted in superstition to rigorous test; holds conviction was based on hunches and impending exoneration of men is prompted by better understanding of fire behavior.
lead_paragraph: What carried three men into prison was not reliable evidence of an intentionally set blaze, but rather an investigation that was disconnected from the dynamics of actual fires.

headline.main: Between Guilt and Innocence, an Evolution in Fire Science
headline.print_headline: Between Guilt and Innocence, an Evolution in Fire Science
